electronic signature meets the requirements of any state law pertaining thereto w va  v w va the west virginia as amended 02 rules of construction a general rule all words and phrases shall be construed and understood according to the common and approved usage of the language but technical words and phrases and such others as may have acquired a peculiar and appropriate meaning in the law shall be construed and understood according to such peculiar and appropriate meaning b gender and plural a word importing the singular number only may be applied to several persons or things as well as to one person or thing  a word importing the plural number only may be applied to one person or thing as well as to several  and a word importing the masculine gender only may be applied to females as well as males w va  c computation of time the time within which an act is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first day and including the last or if the last be a saturday sunday or legal holiday it shall also be excluded w va  et seq d joint authority words purporting to give a joint authority to three or more persons confer such authority upon a majority of them and not upon any less number w va  e officer department whenever a reference is made to a particular officer employee department board commission or other agency without further qualification it shall be construed as if followed by the words of the city of hurricane f tense words used in the past or present tense may include the future as well as the past and present g exceptions the rules of construction shall not apply to any law which contains any express provision excluding such construction or when the subject matter or context of such law may be repugnant thereto 03 repeal of repealing act  effect of repeal a when a law which has repealed another is itself repealed the former law shall not be revived without express words for that purpose w va  b the repeal of a law or its expiration by virtue of any provision contained therein shall not affect any offense committed or penalty or punishment incurred before the repeal took effect or the law expired save only that the proceedings thereafter had shall conform as far as practicable to the laws in force at the time such proceedings take place unless otherwise specially provided  and that if any penalty or punishment be mitigated by the new law such new law may with the consent of the party affected thereby be applied to any judgment pronounced after it has taken effect w va  c the repeal by any provision of the codified ordinances of an ordinance validating previous acts contracts or transactions shall not affect the validity of such acts contracts or transactions but the same shall remain as valid as if there had been no such repeal but no further w va  04 construction of section references a when reference is made to any section or group of sections of the codified ordinances such reference shall extend to and include any amendment of or supplement to the section or group of sections so referred to or any section or sections hereafter enacted in lieu thereof  and unless otherwise provided whenever a reference to a section or group of sections is made in any amendment or supplement to any section of the codified ordinances hereafter enacted such reference shall be deemed to refer to the section or sections as the same shall then stand or as thereafter amended b whenever in a penalty section reference is made to a violation of a section or an inclusive group of sections such reference shall be construed to mean a violation of any provision of the section or sections included in such reference c references in the codified ordinances to action taken or authorized under designated sections of the codified ordinances include in every case action taken or authorized under the applicable legislative provision which is superseded by the codified ordinances d if a section refers to a series of numbers or letters the first and the last number or letters in the series are deemed to be included 05 acts by agent or deputy when a section requires that an act be done by an officer or person it shall be sufficient if it be done by his agent or deputy unless it be such as cannot lawfully be done by deputation w va  06 conflicting provisions if the provisions of different codes articles or sections of the codified ordinances conflict with or contravene each other the provisions bearing the latest passage date shall prevail if the conflicting provisions bear the same passage date the conflict shall be construed so as to be consistent with the meaning or legal effect of the questions of the subject matter taken as a whole 07 separability each section of the codified ordinances and every part of each section is an independent section and part of a section and the holding of any section or a part thereof or its application to any person or circumstances to be unconstitutional void or ineffective for any cause does not affect the validity or constitutionality of any other section or part thereof or its application 08 no liability a nothing in these codified ordinances or any other ordinance or resolution of council shall be construed to impose any liability upon the city or upon any person for any act or omission required or permitted thereby when such act or omission is otherwise lawful in good faith and without malice or mischievous intent and in the case of any city officer or employee is in the line of duty and within the scope of his authority b the city solicitor shall defend city officers and employees against all claims demands actions suits prosecutions and other proceedings brought against them for their acts or omissions while acting in the line of duty and within the purview of subsection a of this section   09 sectional history notes the history notes appearing in parentheses after sections in this not intended to have any legal effect but are merely intended to indicate the source of matter contained in the sections editors notes and references the editors notes and state law reference notes in the codified ordinances are not intended penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established or accruing before the effective date of the codified ordinances supplementation of codified ordinances a by contract or by city personnel supplements to the codified ordinances shall be prepared and printed whenever authorized or directed by the council a supplement to the codified ordinances shall include all substantive permanent and general parts of ordinances passed by the council or adopted by initiative and referendum during the period covered by the supplement and all changes made thereby in the codified ordinances the pages of a supplement shall be so numbered that they will fit properly into the codified ordinances and will where necessary replace pages which have become obsolete or partially obsolete and the new pages shall be so prepared that when they have been inserted the codified ordinances will be current date of the adoption of the latest ordinance included in the supplement b in preparing a supplement to the codified ordinances all portions of the codified ordinances which have been repealed shall be excluded from the codified ordinances by the omission thereof from reprinted pages c when preparing a supplement to the codified ordinances the codifier meaning the person agency or organization authorized to prepare the supplement may make formal nonsubstantive changes in ordinances and parts of ordinances included in the supplement insofar as it is necessary to do so to embody them in the codified ordinances for example the codifier may 1 organize the ordinance material into appropriate subdivisions  2 provide appropriate headings for sections and other subdivisions of the codified ordinances printed in the supplement and make changes in such headings  3 assign appropriate numbers to sections and other subdivisions to be inserted in the codified ordinances and where necessary to accommodate new material change existing section or other subdivision numbers  4 change the words this ordinance or words of the same meaning to this  this  etc as the case may be or to sections ____________ to ____________  inserting section numbers to indicate the sections of the codified ordinances which embody the substantive sections of the ordinance incorporated into the codified ordinances  and 5 make other nonsubstantive changes necessary to preserve the original meaning of ordinance sections inserted into the codified ordinances  but in no case shall the codifier make any change in the meaning or effect of ordinance material included in the supplement or already embodied in the codified ordinances altering codified ordinances it shall be unlawful to change or amend by addition or deletion any part of the codified ordinances or to insert or delete pages or portions thereof or to alter or tamper with the codified ordinances in any manner whatsoever which will cause the law of the city to be misrepresented general penalty whenever in the codified ordinances or in any ordinance of the city any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful or an offense or whenever the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful where no specific penalty is otherwise provided whoever violates any such provision shall be fined not more than $250000 or imprisoned not more than 30 days or both each day any such violation continues shall constitute a separate offense 99  2 article 103  officers and employees generally footnotes  2  state law references and cross references officers generally w va   oath of office w va   terms of office w va   vacancies w va  municipal authorities  elective officers  qualifications  vacancies a the municipal authorities of the city shall consist of a mayor city recorder and five members of council who shall be elected by the qualified voters of the city the mayor recorder and councilmen shall be residents of the city and shall be qualified voters entitled to vote for members of its governing body each official so elected shall continue to be a resident of the city during his entire term of office b if any person elected to council fails to qualify within 20 days after he is declared elected or resigns or ceases to be a resident of the city then his office shall thereby be vacated and council shall fill such vacancy by the election of some qualified person for such unexpired term no person shall be declared elected by council unless he receives the votes of at least a majority of the members elected thereto and the minutes of such meeting show that fact   01 elective officers  election and term the mayor city recorder and members of council shall be elected on the second tuesday of june and shall hold office for a term of four years beginning on the first day of july after their election   02 vacancy in elective office  appointed officers a whenever a vacancy for any cause whatever occurs in the office of mayor the recorder shall perform the duties of the mayor and be invested with all of his power and authority b whenever a vacancy for any cause whatever occurs in the office of recorder council shall elect some qualified person to fill such vacancy until the next city election and until his successor is elected and qualified c whenever a vacancy occurs for any cause whatever in the office of any appointive officer his successor shall be appointed by the person making the original appointment or his successor in office d all elective and appointive officers of the city shall hold their respective offices until their successors are elected or appointed and qualified unless sooner removed e in the event the police chief is removed for reasons other than disciplinary and he was a member of the department prior to his appointment he shall return to the position of police officer with a rank commensurate with his years of service as determined by the council but not less than the rank held at his time of appointment   03  2 officers in addition to elective officers  salaries  clerk a in addition to the municipal authorities mentioned in the city shall have a city manager treasurer municipal court judge chief of police one or more city solicitors building official humane officer or officers and such number of police officers as council may direct all the officers named in this and the preceding sections shall be paid proper salaries which shall be fixed by council b the mayor shall appoint the city treasurer municipal court judge chief of police city solicitors building official and humane officer or officers and except for humane officers and city solicitors these appointments shall require confirmation by council c the city recorder may be appointed to serve also as city treasurer d a clerk may be hired at a salary provided in the annual budget to act as assistant to city officials and clerk of council the city recorder may fill this position   04 duties of officers and employees a council shall prescribe the duties of all of the officers and employees of the city and all such officers and employees shall perform faithfully and diligently all the duties so described by council and the failure to do so by any officer or employee of the city shall be deemed neglect of duty and good cause for dismissal b council shall review and approve job descriptions policies and procedures for all employees of the city employees shall be advised of changes to city policies and procedures and acknowledge their advisement of same failure of an employee to accept the city policies and procedures shall be good cause for dismissal   05  amend no 2004003 2172004 inspection  right of entry whenever any officer or employee of the city is required or authorized by statute the provisions of these codified ordinances or any ordinance or resolution or rules and regulations or orders issued thereunder in order to carry out his duties thereunder to enter any premises or vehicle for the purpose of making an inspection thereof or of anything therein contained such officer or employee shall have the right to enter any such premises or vehicle in accordance with law at any reasonable time and upon display of proper identification in pursuance of such duties  provided that this section shall not be construed as purporting to authorize an unreasonable search and seizure prohibited by of the constitution of west virginia   06 city books and records available  protection a except as may be provided otherwise by state law these codified ordinances or other ordinance to safeguard the security of license tax returns personnel records and other confidential information all records books maps documents and other papers which are maintained on file in any city office shall be open for inspection and use by residents of the city and others having an interest therein during all regular business hours but none shall be removed from the office of its custodian except by authority of the mayor the city recorder or council or pursuant to a valid subpoena duces tecum issuing from a court or officer having jurisdiction in the premises b no person shall without proper authority as provided in subsection a of this section remove from the office of its custodian any record book map file document or other paper which is maintained on file in any city office or court without giving written receipt therefor to the custodian thereof nor shall any person fail to return any such item to its proper custodian within the time set by the custodian for its return c no person shall willfully destroy obliterate secrete deface mark upon disturb the arrangement of damage or otherwise tamper with any record book map file document or other paper which is maintained on file in any city office or court   07 limited authority to administer oaths  false swearing a the mayor the presiding officer of council for the time being the presiding officer of any council committee or of any board commission or other body of the city government and each city officer his deputies and assistants to whom any sworn report return certificate pledge or statement whether oral or in writing is required to be made or submitted by any person pursuant to any provision of these codified ordinances or other ordinance or resolution of council shall have authority to administer the oath so required  provided that nothing in this section is construed as purporting to authorize the administration of any oath which by law is required to be administered by a judicial officer notary public or other officer authorized by statute to administer oaths nor shall this section be construed as purporting to authorize the taking of any acknowledgment of any signature or seal for the purpose of recording in the office of the clerk of the county court or elsewhere other than in the office of the city recorder or some other officer of this city b no person to whom an oath has been administered pursuant to this section shall knowingly make any false report return certificate or statement oral or written concerning any matter whatsoever in violation of such oath   08 authority of deputies assistants and subordinates authority vested in and duties imposed upon city officers by state law these codified ordinances or other ordinances and resolutions of council may when they so authorize be exercised or performed by their deputies assistants and other subordinates to the extent not prohibited by state law these codified ordinances or other ordinance or resolution of council   09 article 104  city manager appointment the city manager shall be appointed by council for an indefinite term as provided by law before taking office the city manager shall furnish a fidelity bond in the amount of $5000000 conditioned upon the faithful performance of the duties of the office with a corporation licensed to do business in this state as surety such bond shall be filed with the recorder after being approved by council  10401 general duties a the city manager shall have and exercise all powers and duties assigned to the position by statute and such other authority as may be granted by council the city manager shall be charged with the enforcement of the ordinances of the city insofar as their enforcement is within the powers of the city b the city manager shall update the council monthly shall keep the council informed as to the affairs of the city and shall recommend to council such actions as may be necessary or expedient for the welfare of the city c the city manager shall have custody of and be responsible for maintaining all bonds and records and papers in such fireproof vault as the city shall provide  10402 employees the city manager shall review the qualifications of prospective employees other than those authorized by the mayor or council for hiring employee evaluations andor employee disciplinary claims the city manager may delegate to any other official or supervisor the authority to hire or discharge any employee under such official or supervisor  10403 officers and departments a all appointive offices of the city shall be filled by appointment by the city manager except where otherwise provided by city such city manager shall report to council such appointments for their approval or any removal from office before such action is final b every administrative department of the city shall be under the supervision and approval of the city manager who shall have the power to remove from office any officer appointed by such city manager with the approval of council  10404 contracts a the city manager shall examine and approve all proposed contracts to which the city may be a party and may sign on behalf of the city any contract authorized by council excepting where council directs that some other officer or officers shall do so b the city manager shall be responsible for execution of all terms of any contract to which the city is a party and shall ensure that such terms are fully performed by all parties thereto  10405 purchases the city manager shall be the general purchasing agent of the city and except where specific provision to the contrary is made by law shall approve all purchases of supplies materials and equipment authorized by council in the manner prescribed by and subject to the limitations imposed by law  10406 appropriation and levies a the city manager shall cause to be prepared each year the annual appropriation budget in time for consideration and enactment by council during the first quarter of the calendar year  and shall prepare the tax levy ordinance for passage and file a certified copy thereof with the state tax commissioner within the time required by law b the city manager shall keep current accounts of the amounts appropriated and the amounts spent out of each appropriation showing the unexpended appropriations at all times  10407 accounts the city manager shall keep current accounts showing at all times the fiscal condition of the city including the current and anticipated expenses appropriations cash on hand and anticipated revenue of all municipal funds and accounts  and shall see to the collection of all money due the city  10408 inventories the city manager shall keep a current inventory showing all real and personal property of the city and its location and shall be responsible for the care and custody of all such property including equipment buildings parks and all other city property which is not by law assigned to some other officer or body for care and control  10409 reports and publications the city manager shall be responsible for the publication of all notices ordinances or other documents required by law to be published and shall prepare or cause to be prepared all reports which the city or any of the officials thereof are required by law to prepare  10410 elections the city manager shall assist the recorder with all notices ballots and election supplies necessary in connection with the municipal elections  10411 records  certificates a the city manager shall prepare and have custody of all municipal records required by law to be kept by the city and not by a specific officer where the law makes it the duty of a specific officer to keep or maintain records the city manager shall make available to such officer assistance for the preparation of such records and shall make available a place for the custody of such records b where the law requires or provides for certification of any records or documents by any officer of the city the city manager shall cause such records or documents to be properly prepared and presented to such officer for his signature  10412 collector and comptroller the city manager shall be ex officio city collector and city comptroller unless such offices or either them are duly filled by appointment  and shall perform the duties of each such office in the absence of such appointment to either of them  10413 maps  plats the city manager shall cause to be kept a complete set of maps and plats showing the location of all city utilities and other municipal properties all streets and other public places and all lots or parcels of land subdivided according to law these records shall be filed in a safe and secure environment  10414 grants and capital projects the city manager shall coordinate and manage grant requests as well as capital projects for improvements for all city departments  10415 office the city manager shall maintain an office in the municipal building and shall spend such time in the performance of the aforementioned duties as may be required by the council  10416 article 105  elections footnotes  3  state law references and cross references municipal elections w va a  municipal voting precincts w va   municipal precinct registration records w va   absentee voting in municipal elections w va   integration of municipal elections with systems of permanent registration w va   special municipal elections w va a candidates for public office  procedures for filing  fees a placement of candidate on ballot any person who is otherwise qualified for public office may be placed on the ballot for election of any municipal office by either of the following methods 1 convention any candidate who shall be nominated at a convention must be nominated between the period beginning february 1 and no later than march 31 of the election year pursuant to the election laws of the state of west virginia notice of such convention shall give the manner date time and location of such convention by publication of notice thereof in a newspaper of general circulation published in the vicinity of the city such publication shall be made two consecutive weeks in a qualified newspaper no sooner than 14 days prior to such convention 2 recognized parties the political parties recognized to hold conventions are the citizens party and the peoples party participating persons attending the conventions must be citizens of the city of hurricane 3 quorum and procedures a quorum of not less than 15 shall be required to hold a qualified convention an election of a chairperson and an executive committee of not less than three members shall be held the chairperson shall conduct the convention and open the floor for nominations for candidates for mayor recorder and five council positions any and all nominations made at such conventions shall be certified by the executive board to the city recorder no later than april 1 of the election year and shall be accompanied by all necessary filing forms and fees 4 petition any candidate seeking a public office in the city may be placed on the ballot for election to said office if such candidate shall present no later than april 1 of the election year a petition signed by no less than ten percent of the total number of persons voting in the last regular city general election such petition shall contain the names and valid signatures of qualified voters and shall be presented to the city recorder together with the appropriate filing form and fee 5 filing fees the filing fees for public offices are established as follows $20000 for the office of mayor  $10000 for the office of city recorder  and $5000 for the office of city council b filing fee for party nominating slate of candidates in the event that a party nominates an entire slate of candidates for office such party shall pay a filing fee of $55000 01     ballot position  preparation of ballots  publication of ballot  methods of voting a the drawing for ballot positions by candidates shall take place on the 70th day next preceding the general election b the preparation of the election ballot and the method of voting together with all other aspects of all city elections shall fully conform where applicable to the requirement of of the west virginia w va  et seq 02     date of election  date of assumption of office a in every election year the election shall be held on the second tuesday in the month of june of the election year all polling places shall be open at  am and shall remain open until  pm b each successful candidate for public office shall assume full responsibility for his office on the first day of the month of july of the election year 03   voter registration  eligibility the registration of voters of the city of hurricane shall be integrated with the system of permanent registration of voters established by w va  no voter otherwise qualified shall be permitted to vote an unchallenged ballot at any election within the city unless he is duly registered under the provisions of west virginia law the registration records shall be maintained by and shall remain in the possession of the clerk of the county commission except for use in municipal elections 04     duties of city recorder the city recorder acting in accord with state law shall perform such duties relating to all municipal elections held under the municipal authority as the clerks of the county and circuit courts of the county perform under state laws in relation to state county and district elections in the county  and he shall likewise be the custodian of all ballots tally sheets and other related materials pertaining to the election 05   article 107  ethics in parttime who derive a salary payment of wages or other direct remuneration from the city and does now hereby affirm ratify and adopt such state defined purposes as being the same purposes of this such amendments 04   article 109  contracts and purchases footnotes  5  state law references and cross references state purchasing w va a31 et seq  purchasing competitive bidding w va  advertisement of bids generally  contracts whenever any contract is proposed to be entered into by the city involving the expenditure of more than $2500000 the city manager shall publish an advertisement calling for bids for this work unless the decision is to do this work with city personnel or others employed by the city for such purposes the time for opening such bids shall not be less than five days from the date of the first publication of the advertisement the advertisement shall be printed for at least two successive weeks in two newspapers of general circulation in the city preceding the time of opening the bids and such publication shall be deemed reasonable and due notice council shall reserve the right to reject any and all bids but the contract if let shall be let to the lowest responsible bidder council reserves the right to enter into contracts that do not exceed two years that pertain to health property and liability insurance 01  1    1 contents of advertisements notice and advertising nothing in shall preclude council from directing that invitations to bid shall also be given to contractors in other localities believed to be qualified to perform the work sought to be performed or from causing additional advertisements from being published in other localities  provided that all such invitations and advertisements conform to the requirements of no prospective bidder shall be given any information not given to all other prospective bidders   03 bidding procedure a submission of bids each bid for such work shall be made upon a blank form to be furnished by the city manager and shall be placed in a sealed envelope addressed to the city manager and endorsed proposals for ____________  ____________  ____________  each bid shall be signed by the bidder or by an authorized officer or agent where the bid is by firm or corporation the bid shall not be opened before the time and hour fixed in the notice b deposits by bidders the amount of the cash or bond deposited shall be equal to five percent of the total cost of the work as estimated by the city manager  provided that no deposit shall be less than $2500 the deposit made shall be conditioned so that the successful bidder enters into a written contract to do the work bid for according to the terms of his bid and furnishes approved security within ten days after the award has been made and the bidder notified thereof c bidders deposit forfeited if any bidder to whom a contract is awarded fails to enter into a contract and to furnish approved security within the time specified his deposit shall be forfeited to the city and the city manager may advertise for new bids d disposition of deposits whenever a contract for public work or supplies has been awarded the city manager shall be authorized to refund the deposit of each unsuccessful bidder the deposit of the successful bidder shall be retained until the contract is entered into and approved by the city manager e opening of bids no bids shall be opened and read before the time indicated in the advertisement f rejection of bids if in any bid blanks are not properly filled up so as to make the bid complete and without an ambiguity as to its intent and meaning or if a bid has any alteration or erasure upon it or if it is not properly signed or if the certificate of deposit has not been enclosed with the bid as hereinbefore provided then the bid shall be rejected g action upon bids  award of contract upon the opening and consideration of all bids by the city manager he shall submit them to council together with his calculations and recommendations for appropriate action with respect to awarding the contract  provided that council or the city manager has the authority to reject all bids 2510  04 article 111  emergency services footnotes  6  state law references and cross references homeland security and emergency management w va  et seq policy and purpose a in view of the existing and increasing possibility of the occurrence of disasters of unprecedented size and destructiveness resulting from terrorism enemy attack sabotage or other hostile action or from fire flood earthquakes or other natural or manmade causes and in order to ensure that preparations of the city will be adequate to deal with such disasters and generally to provide for the common defense and to protect the public peace health and safety and to preserve the lives and property of the people of this city it is hereby found and declared to be necessary 1 to create a city emergency organization  2 to provide for the rendering of mutual aid to other cities within the state and if necessary and only by compact with the approval of the governor of the state the neighboring cities and counties of another state  3 to cooperate with the state government with respect to carrying out emergency services and homeland security functions b it is further declared to be the purpose of this the policy of this city that all homeland security and emergency management functions of the city be coordinated to the maximum extent with the state government including its various departments and agencies with other cities and localities and with private agencies of every type to the end that the most effective preparation and use may be made of this citys manpower resources and facilities for dealing with any disaster that may occur   01 definitions for the purposes of this the following words and phrases shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them by this section emergency services means the preparation for and the carrying out of all emergency functions other than functions for which military forces are primarily responsible to protect respond and recover to prevent detect deter and mitigate to minimize and repair injury and damage resulting from disasters caused by flooding terrorism enemy attack sabotage or other natural or other manmade causes these functions include without limitation firefighting services police services medical and health services communications radiological chemical and other special weapons defense evacuation of persons from stricken areas emergency welfare services emergency transportation existing or properly assigned functions of plant protection temporary restoration of public utility services and other functions related to the health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city together with all other activities necessary or incidental to the preparation for and carrying out of the foregoing functions disaster includes the imminent threat of disaster as well as its occurrence and any power or authority exercisable on account of a disaster may be exercised during the period when there is an imminent threat thereof 02 emergency services council there is hereby created an emergency services council hereinafter called council which shall consist of five residents appointed by city council who shall advise the city emergency services director provided for in the next section on all matters pertaining to emergency services the chairperson of the council shall be elected by the members the members thereof shall serve without compensation but shall be reimbursed for the reasonable and necessary expenses actually incurred in the performance of their duties the city manager with the approval of the city council shall be responsible for and have general direction and control of the emergency services of the city and have such other powers as are granted and conferred by this are not inconsistent with other ordinances of this city   03 director of emergency services the city manager is hereby authorized to appoint a director of emergency services approved by city council who shall perform such duties as are imposed upon him by this as are delegated to him when not contrary to other ordinances of this city   04 duties of director the director shall coordinate the activities of all organizations for emergency services within this city and shall maintain liaison with and cooperate with the emergency services within the state and within the state government when such authority is delegated to him by the city manager the director shall have direct responsibility for the organization administration and operation of the city organization for emergency services subject to the direction and control of the city manager   05 other duties of director a in performing his duties under this the director is authorized to cooperate with the state government with other cities and counties and with private agencies in all matters pertaining to the emergency services of the city andor the state b in performing his duties under this to effect its policy and purpose the director is further authorized and empowered 1 to make amend and rescind the necessary orders rules and regulations to carry out the provisions of this the limits of the authority conferred upon him with due consideration of the plans of the state government 2 to prepare a comprehensive plan and program for the emergency services of the city such plan and program to be integrated into and coordinated with the emergency services plans of the state government and of other cities and counties within the state to the fullest extent 3 in accordance with such plan and program for this city to procure supplies and equipment to institute training programs and public information programs and to take all the preparatory steps including the partial or full mobilization of the emergency services organization in advance of actual disaster to ensure the furnishing of adequately trained an equipped forces of emergency services personnel in time of need 4 to make such studies and surveys of the city industries resources and facilities in this as may be necessary to ascertain the capabilities of the city emergency services and to plan for the most efficient emergency use thereof 5 on behalf of this city to enter into mutual aid arrangements with other cities and counties within this state and also with the approval of the governor of the state with emergency services organizations of other states for reciprocal emergency aid and assistance in case of disaster too great to be dealt with unassisted 6 to delegate any administrative authority invested in him under this to provide for the subdelegation of any such authority 7 to cooperate with the governor and the west virginia division of homeland security and emergency management and the officials and agencies of other cities and to coordinate the emergency services of the city and state including the direction or control of a blackouts and practice blackouts air raid drills mobilization of emergency services forces and other tests and exercises  b warnings and signals for drills or attacks and the mechanical devices to be used in connection therewith  c the effective screening or extinguishing of all lights and lighting devices and appliances  d shutting off water mains gas mains electric power connections and the suspension of all other utility services  e the conduct of civilians and the movement and cessation of movement of pedestrians and vehicular traffic during prior to and subsequent to drills or attack  f public meetings or gatherings  and g the evacuation and reception of the civilian population   06 mutual aid arrangements a the director of the organization for emergency services may in collaboration with other public and private agencies within this state develop or cause to be developed mutual aid arrangements for reciprocal emergency aid and assistance in case of disaster too great to be dealt with unassisted such arrangements shall be consistent with the state emergency services plan and program and in time of emergency the city organization shall render assistance in accordance with mutual aid agreements b the director of the organization may subject to the approval of the governor enter into mutual aid arrangements with emergency service and civil defense organizations or agencies of other states for reciprocal emergency aid and assistance in case of disaster too great to be dealt with unassisted 01 meetings  regular special and executive a council shall meet in regular session of the first monday of each month at  pm in the council chambers in the city building when the regular meeting is designated person at the front door or bulletin board of the city building stating the date time and place fixed and entered of record by council for the holding of regularly scheduled meetings in addition a copy of the agenda for each regularly scheduled meeting shall be posted at the same location by the recorder or designated person not less than 72 hours before such regular meeting is to be held c if a particular regularly scheduled meeting is canceled or postponed a notice of such cancellation or postponement shall be posted at the same location as soon as feasible after such cancellation or postponement has been determined d special meetings of council shall be held when called by the mayor or four members thereof except in the event of an emergency requiring immediate official action the time place and purpose of all special meetings shall be published in the official recognized newspaper of general circulation in the city no business other than that stated in the newspaper announcement shall be considered at such meeting e in addition a notice shall be posted by the recorder or designated person at the front door or bulletin board of the city hall not less that 72 hours before a specially scheduled meeting is to be held stating the date time place and purpose for which such special meeting shall be held if the special meeting is canceled a notice of officer shall control the course of the proceeding to take live testimony on behalf of council and shall rule in the first instance on all objections presented b interrogation of witnesses for any copy any party to those proceedings specifically including the city may appeal to the full city council any ruling of the presiding officer made during the proceeding on any question of privilege by issues and providing a succinct summary of the legal and factual grounds that will be advanced in support of the appeal b procedures on appeal by the end of the regular business hours of the city two 2 business days after filing the notice of appeal pursuant to subsection a of this each appellant shall file with the city clerk and serve on all parties and on the city solicitor if the city is not a party a brief not to exceed 15 pages in a form that complies with the requirements of rule 6 of the west virginia rules for trial courts promulgated by the west virginia supreme court of appeals each appellee in each appeal shall file with the city clerk and serve on all parties and on the city solicitor if the city is not a party its responsive brief not to exceed 15 pages in a form that complies with the requirements of rule 6 of the west virginia rules for trial courts promulgated by the west virginia supreme court of appeals with the city clerk on or before the end of the regular business hours of the city five business days after the appellant files his brief with the city clerk c oral argument discretionary with council on the cover page of its brief each appellant and appellee to an appeal pursuant to this shall state whether that party is requesting an opportunity to present an oral argument before the full city council at the conclusion of the briefing on each appeal the city council will determine whether in its judgment oral argument will aid the council in a just and expeditious resolution of the appeal if the request for oral argument is granted by the council the parties to the appeal will be notified by the city council of the date and time scheduled for council to hear their oral arguments d exhaustion of municipal remedies on privilege issues required any party to any legislative investigative proceeding to take live testimony pursuant to of this municipal to challenge directly or indirectly any privilege ruling of the presiding officer made in such proceeding regardless of by whom the challenge before any court was commenced must first raise the challenge of such party requesting any relief from that privilege ruling pursuant to the process set forth in this of this municipal thereafter exhaust all of the remedies provided by law with respect to such a challenge to any such privilege ruling failure of any such party to first exhaust the municipal remedies available pursuant to this of this municipal bar any request to any court or agency for relief in any form from the privilege ruling of the presiding officer 1  11524 recovery of funds  purposes a no expenditure from the paving and sewer fund shall be made except for a purpose for which assessments were levied against property owners or for payments of principal interest and deposited to the credit of the general fund may be used by the city in paying the expenses of the city government and for such improvements of city property streets sewers parks and public buildings and places as may be justified by the condition of the citys finances and the laws and ordinances governing the levying collection and expenditure of the city funds c no expenditure shall be made from any special fund or fund held in escrow except for a purpose for which such fund or escrow was established   07 disbursement of general fund  contracts the general fund at the time of laying the annual tax levy shall be apportioned by council for the several purposes for which it was levied or collected and for the general needs of the city government but not including special funds and council shall as nearly as possible keep the expenses of each department or branch of the city service within the limits of such apportionment but in the event that a saving can be made in the expenses of any one department such saving may be applied to any deficit which may arise in the apportionment for any other department and any excess of revenue over and above the estimated collections from any given source during the fiscal year may likewise be applied to any such deficit but under no circumstances shall the city expend or contract for the expenditure of more money than the amount estimated each year in the annual estimate published in march of each year as the probable receipts for the fiscal year plus any money received into the treasury by reason of collections for such fiscal year to the credit of the general fund in excess of the amount estimated to be received from any such known source of revenue   08 accounts an account shall be kept by the city treasurer showing the warrants drawn on the several funds each day which account shall be kept posted up to within 48 hours of the time when the last warrant was drawn and the account shall be consolidated at the end of each fiscal year into a report as prescribed by w va  et seq   09 annual financial statement a the city treasurer within 90 days after the beginning of each fiscal year shall prepare on a form to be prescribed by the state tax commissioner and cause to be published a sworn statement revealing 1 the receipts and expenditures of the city during the previous fiscal year arranged under descriptive headings 2 the name of each person who received more than $5000 from any fund during the previous fiscal year together with the amount received and the purpose for which paid and 3 all debts of the city the purpose for which each debt was contracted its due date and to what date the interest thereon has been paid such statement shall be published as a class i legal advertisement in compliance with the provisions of w va  et seq and the publication area for such publication shall be the city b the city recorder shall transmit to any resident of the city upon request a copy of any published statement for the fiscal year designated supplemented by a document listing the names of each person who received less than $5000 from any fund during such fiscal year and showing the amount paid to each and the purpose for which paid and an itemization of the salaries receipts payments to each individual vendor and expenditures to employees of municipal offices companies and departments otherwise published in the aggregate c the statement required by subsection a of this section shall be sworn to by the city recorder the mayor and two councilmen as soon as practicable following the close of the fiscal year a copy of any statement herein required shall be filed by the city recorder with the state tax commissioner the clerk of the county commission and the clerk of the circuit court d where in subsections a and b of this section salaries receipts payments to each individual vendor and expenditures are published in the aggregate the city shall upon written request provide to any resident of the city an itemized accounting of the salaries receipts payments to each individual vendor and expenditures 10 indebtedness to city  delinquent payments the city treasurer upon application for and prior to paying out money to any person entitled thereto may in the exercise of sound discretion first ascertain whether such person is delinquent in the payment of any city tax or is otherwise indebted to the city insofar as such indebtedness if any may appear on the citys records upon so ascertaining that such person is in fact indebted to the city the city treasurer shall then take proper action pursuant to the established administrative and accounting procedures to apply all or such part of the amount to which such person is entitled to receive from the city to the full or partial payment as the case may be of his debt to the city  and if the amount such person is entitled to receive from the city exceeds the amount of his indebtedness to the city the treasurer shall then pay out to such person the amount of such excess and in either case the treasurer shall give to such person a memorandum of the entire transaction punitive action 2 hearing board appointment  term the hearing board shall be a standing hearing board the department chief shall appoint the first member  the fraternal order of police shall appoint the second member the first and second members shall appoint by agreement the third member from the business community of the three original appointments the first member shall serve for six years form the date of his appointment  the second member shall serve for four years from the date of his appointment  and the third member shall serve for two years from the date of his appointment after the original appointments all appointments shall be made for periods of four years each by the designated appointing authority in the event that any member shall cease to be a member due to death resignation final removal or other cause a new member shall be appointed within 30 days of the date the exmember ceased to be a member this appointment shall be made by the officer or body who in the first instance appointed the member who is no longer a member when the hearing board is appointed the three members shall elect one of their number to act as president of the board who shall serve as president for one year in the event that a member has had a part in the investigation or interrogation of an accused officer or is related by consanguinity or affinity to an accused officer that member shall be recused from participation in the accused officers hearing in such an instance the officer or body who in the first instance appointed the recused member shall appoint another person for the sole purpose of the accused officers hearing no member shall hold any other office other than the office of notary public under the united states the state of west virginia or any municipality county or other political subdivision thereof  nor shall any member serve on any political committee or take any active part in the management of any political campaign 3 removal of member of hearing board any member of a hearing board appointed under subsection a2 of this section may be removed as provided in this subsection the mayor of the city may at any time remove any hearing board member for good cause which shall be stated in writing and made a part of the records of the hearing board however within ten days of removing any member the mayor shall file in the circuit clerks office of putnam county a petition setting forth in full the reason for the removal and seeking the circuit courts confirmation of the mayors removal of the member the mayor shall file a copy of the petition with the removed member at the same time it is filed with the circuit clerk the petition shall have precedence on the circuit courts docket and shall be heard as soon as practicable on the request of the removed member w va a14d any resident of the city shall have the right at any time to seek the removal of any hearing board member to do so the resident shall file a petition in the circuit clerks office of putnam county the resident shall also serve a copy of the petition on the member sought to be removed any party adversely affected by the circuit courts or judges decision shall have the right to petition the supreme count of appeals for a review of the decision as in other civil cases b investigation and interrogation of a police officer when any police officer is under investigation and subjected to interrogation by his commanding officer or any other member of the employing police department which could lead to punitive action such interrogation shall be conducted under the following conditions 1 the interrogation shall be conducted at a reasonable hour preferably at a time when the police officer is on duty or during his normal working hours unless the seriousness of the investigation requires otherwise if such interrogation does occur during offduty time of the police officer being interrogated such officer shall be compensated for such offduty time in accordance with regular department procedure if the interrogation of the police officer occurs during his regular duty hours such officer shall not be released from employment for any work missed due to interrogation 2 any police officer under investigation shall be informed of the nature of the investigation prior to any interrogation such officer shall also be informed of the name rank and command of the officer in charge of the interrogation the interrogating officers and all other persons to be present during the interrogation no more than three interrogators at one time shall question the officer under investigation 3 no police officer under interrogation shall be subjected to offensive language or threatened with punitive action no promise of reward shall be made as an inducement to answering questions 4 the complete interrogation of any police officer shall be recorded either written taped or transcribed upon request of the law enforcement officer under investigation or his counsel and upon advance payment of the reasonable cost thereof a copy of the record shall be made available to him not less than ten days prior to any hearing 5 upon filing a formal written statement of charges or whenever an interrogation focuses on matters which are likely to result in punitive action against any police officer then the officer shall have the right to be represented by counsel who may be present at all times during such interrogation 6 nothing herein shall prohibit the immediate temporary suspension pending an investigation from duty of any police officer who reports for duty under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances or under the influence of an apparent mental or emotional disorder which would prevent the officer from performing his duties c hearing 1 before taking any punitive action against an accused officer the police department shall give notice to the accused officer that he is entitled to a hearing on the issues by a hearing board the notice shall state the time and place of the hearing and the issues involved and shall be delivered to the accused officer no later than ten days prior to the hearing 2 when an accused officer faces any recommended punitive action the applicable hearing board shall conduct a hearing pursuant to the provisions of subsection c of this section 3 the following requirements shall govern the operation conduct of a hearing board under subsection b of this section a the hearing board shall keep an official record of each hearing it conducts the official record shall include the testimony offered and exhibits introduced at the hearing b both the police department and the accused officer shall be given ample opportunity to present evidence and argument with respect to any issue raised at the hearing c the hearing board may subpoena witnesses and administer oaths or affirmations and examine any individual under oath and may require and compel the production of records books papers contracts and other documents in connection with any issue raised at the hearing d the hearing board shall prepare a written order detailing any decision or action it takes as a result of the hearing the written order shall include written findings of fact setting forth a concise statement of the hearing boards factual findings and conclusions on each issue raised at the hearing the hearing board shall handdeliver or promptly mail a copy of the written order to the accused officer or his attorney of record e a hearing boards order is binding on all parties involved unless it is overturned in the appeal process described in subsection e of this section d right to refuse to disclose personal finances  exceptions no police officer shall be required or requested for purposes of job assignment or other personnel action to disclose any item of his property income assets source of income debts or personal or domestic expenditures unless such information is obtained legal procedures or is necessary for the employing agency to ascertain the desirability of assigning the police officer to a specialized unit in which there is a strong possibility that bribes or other improper inducements might be offered e appeal a hearing boards decision rendered may be appealed by the police officer adversely affected by the order or by the department chief if he believes that the department would be adversely affected by the hearing boards order an appeal under this be made to the circuit court of the county in which the police officer resides 07    amend no 200501  13307 372005 article 137 future growth of the city with due regard to its relation to neighboring territory with the general purpose of guiding and accomplishing a coordinated adjusted and harmonious development of the city and its environs which will in accordance with present and future needs best promote health safety morals order convenience prosperity and general welfare as well as efficiency and economy in the authority footnotes  18  state law references and cross references department of development authorized w va a purposes the purpose of the hurricane development authority will be to promote develop business transactions the location of new business and industry within hurricane and rehabilitate and assist existing businesses and industries therein also the hurricane development authority will stimulate and promote expansion of business and industrial development and maximum opportunities and maintain the economic stability of hurricane to provide maximum opportunities for employment encourage thrift and improve the standard of living of the citizens of hurricane cooperating with other organizations federal state or local in the promotion and advancement of industrial commercial agricultural and recreational developments where appropriate the hurricane development authority may furnish money and credit land and industrial sites technical assistance or other such aid as may be deemed requisite to approved and deserving applicants for the promotion development and conduct of business activity within hurricane 01   control of authority  appointment and terms  vacancies  removal of members a the management and control of the hurricane development authority its property operations business and affairs shall be lodged in a board of nine persons who shall be appointed by the council and shall be known as members of the hurricane development authority one member of the hurricane development authority shall also be a member of the governing body appointed to represent it on the board other members of the hurricane development authority shall include representatives of business industry and labor b the members of the hurricane development authority shall be appointed and serve respectfully for staggered terms of three years each a member of the hurricane development authority may be reappointed for an additional term or terms as the council may deem proper if a member resigns is removed for any other reason than his membership terminates during his term of office a successor shall be appointed by council to fill the remainder of the term members in office at the expiration of their respective terms shall continue to serve until their successors have been appointed the appointing agency may at any time remove its appointed member of the hurricane development authority by an order duly entered of record or by other action appropriate for such appointing agency and may appoint a successor member for any member so removed 02   qualifications of members all members of the hurricane development authority are not required to be citizens of the city where the authority will operate and bona fide residents of the city in which council shall make the appointments 03     compensation of members  expenses  excusal of member from voting where conflict of interest involved a no member of the hurricane development authority shall receive any compensation whether in formal salary per diem allowance or otherwise in connection with his services as such member each member of the hurricane development authority shall however be entitled to reimbursement by the authority for any necessary expenditures in connection with the performance of his general duties as such member b each member present during any meeting of the hurricane development authority when any question is put shall vote unless he is immediately and particularly interested therein before such a question is put any member having direct personal or pecuniary interest therein shall announce this fact and request to be excused from voting the presiding officer of the meeting or a majority of the members present may then excuse the members from voting upon the question the disqualifying interest must be such as affects the members directly and not as one of a class 04   authority to be a public corporation the hurricane development authority in certain criminal cases whenever a defendant who has been charged with an offense for which a period of confinement in jail may be imposed is brought before the municipal court the defendant is entitled to a trial by jury if a municipal court judge determines upon demand of a defendant to conduct a trial by jury in a criminal matter the municipal court shall follow the procedures set forth in the rules of criminal procedure for magistrate courts promulgated by the supreme court of appeals except that the jury in municipal court shall consist of 12 members 2 trial by jury in certain civil cases a right to jury trial in civil case whenever a party to a civil action before the municipal court shall be entitled by the constitution or statutes of the united states or of the state of west virginia to a trial by jury and the municipal court judge determines that a timely and proper demand for a jury trial has been made in compliance with the requirements of subsection b of this a party entitled to make such a demand the municipal court shall conduct a trial by jury of those claims entitled to be tried by a jury in that civil matter in conducting a jury trial pursuant to this the municipal court shall follow the procedures set forth in the rules of civil procedure for magistrate courts promulgated by the supreme court of appeals except that the jury in municipal court shall consist of 12 members b assertion of the right to trial by jury to be effective the election for trial by jury pursuant to this be made in writing by the party asserting the right any time after the commencement of the action but not later than 1 20 days after the service of any first timely filed answer to the complaint or 2 five days after service of the summons and complaint in cases involving expedited proceedings when the right to a jury trial is asserted in a case involving an expedited proceeding the trial shall be scheduled as soon as a jury panel can be assembled c waiver the bondsman as if it were a forthcoming bond on default the defendant may be rearrested and committed to work out the fine and costs as provided in this b the municipal court shall see that all such the defendant or his attorney b such appellant shall execute an appeal bond with security deemed sufficient by the municipal court to cover all the fines and costs and the costs of the appellate court the first day of the next regular term thereof and performs and satisfies any judgment which may be rendered against him by the appellate court on such appeal and not depart from the court without leave c in case a jail sentence has been imposed the appeal bond shall be increased by $10000 for each day thereof in addition to the penalty of double the fine and costs d upon the appeal the warrant of arrest if any the transcript of judgment the appeal bond and other papers in the case shall forthwith be delivered to the clerk of the circuit court of putnam county the circuit court shall proceed vehicle without a certificate of completion of a vehicle rider awareness course this does not apply to the operation of an allterrain vehicle on any private or public recreational trail or area affiliated trail or area operated by a person or entity which has in place a safety program  atv violations no atv may be operated in the city 1 on any interstate highway except by public safety personnel responding to emergencies  2 on any road or highway with a center line or more than two lanes except for the purpose of crossing the road street of highway if a the crossing is made at an angle of approximately 90 degrees to the direction of the highway and at a place where no obstruction prevents a quick and safe crossing  b the vehicle is brought to a complete stop before crossing the shoulder or main traveled way of the highway  c the operator yields his or her rightofway to all oncoming traffic that constitutes an immediate potential hazard  d both the headlight and taillight are illuminated when the crossing is made if the vehicle is so equipped  penalty whoever violated any provision of this be fined $10000 for the first violation and not more than $50000 for each vehicle may 1 park or stand irrespective of the provisions of this traffic   2 proceed past a red or stop signal or stop sign but only after slowing down as may be necessary for safe operation  3 exceed the speed limits so long as he does not endanger life or property  4 disregard regulations governing direction of movement or turning in specified directions c the exemptions herein granted to an authorized emergency vehicle operated as a police vehicle need not be equipped with or display a warning light visible from in front of the vehicle d the foregoing provisions shall not relieve the traffic offenses b under the procedure authorized above persons found guilty of or pleading no contest to certain traffic offenses may request the municipal court withhold for a period not to exceed 90 days the entry of a judgment of conviction to permit the person to complete a driver safety education course designated by the chief of police and approved by the municipal court if the person attends and completes said course to the satisfaction of the court the court shall without entering a judgment of conviction dismiss the proceeding against the person c it is the responsibility of the person requesting the alternative disposition to provide proof of satisfactory course completion to the court in not more than 90 days failure to provide the proof in the time allowed will result in the entry of the judgment of conviction d it shall be a condition of any prejudgment alternative disposition authorized by the provisions of this section that the person pay any fine assessed by the court and pay all fees and costs required to be paid by any provision of this a person is convicted of a criminal traffic offense the municipal court shall collect such fees and costs as are required by any provision of this transmit the moneys collected as required by law additionally the person shall pay an administrative fee of up to $10000 as well as any course fees andor instructor fees associated with the approved driver safety education course e this procedure is available to persons convicted of certain minor traffic offenses including but not limited to exceeding posted speed limits failure to obey traffic control devices and other similar offenses the decision to grant a request for prejudgment alternative disposition is that of the municipal court f the procedure authorized by the provisions of this section shall not be available to any person who 1 holds a commercial drivers license issued by this state or by any other state or jurisdiction  2 is arrested subsequent conviction shall be fined not more than $50000 plus the costs imposed by the municipal court w va c34a 02  2 traffic control signal terms and lights whenever traffic is controlled by traffic control signals exhibiting the words go caution or stop or exhibiting different colored lights successively one at a time or with arrows the following colors only shall be used and such terms and lights shall indicate and apply to drivers of vehicles and pedestrians as follows 1 green alone or go a vehicular traffic facing the signal except when prohibited under may proceed straight turn right or left unless a sign at such place prohibits either such turn but vehicular traffic including vehicles turning right or left shall yield the rightofway to other vehicles and to pedestrians lawfully within the intersection or an adjacent crosswalk at the time such signal is exhibited b pedestrians facing the signal may proceed across the roadway within any marked or unmarked crosswalk 2 yellow alone or caution when showing following the green or go signal a vehicular traffic facing the signal is thereby warned that the red or stop signal will be exhibited immediately thereafter and such vehicular traffic shall not enter or be crossing the intersection when the red or stop signal is exhibited b pedestrians facing such signal are thereby advised that there is insufficient time to cross the roadway and any pedestrian then starting to cross shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles 3 red alone or stop a vehicular traffic facing the signal shall stop before entering the crosswalk on the near side of the intersection or if none then before entering the intersection and shall remain standing until green or go is shown alone except as provided in subsection 3b and c of this section b a vehicle which is stopped in obedience to a red or stop signal as close as practicable at the entrance to the crosswalk on the near side of the intersection or if none then at the entrance to the intersection may cautiously make a right turn but such vehicle shall yield the rightofway to pedestrians lawfully within a crosswalk and to other vehicular traffic proceeding as directed by the signal at such intersection except that council may by ordinance prohibit any such right turn against a red or stop signal at any intersection which ordinance shall be effective when a sign is erected at such intersection giving notice thereof c a vehicle which is stopped in obedience to a red or stop signal as close as practicable at the entrance to the crosswalk on the near side of the intersection or if none then at the entrance to the intersection on a oneway street which intersects another oneway street on which traffic moves to the left may cautiously make a left turn into the oneway street but such vehicle shall yield the rightofway to pedestrians lawfully within a crosswalk and to other vehicular traffic proceeding as directed by the signal at such intersection except that council may by ordinance prohibit any such left turn against a red or stop signal at any intersection which ordinance shall be effective when a sign is erected at such intersection giving notice thereof d no pedestrian facing such signal shall enter the roadway unless he can do so safely and without interfering with any vehicular traffic 4 red with green arrow a vehicular traffic between the hours of  noon and  pm and between the hours of  pm and  pm 3 sound amplifying equipment shall not be operated unless the sound truck upon which such equipment is mounted is operated at a speed of at least ten miles per hour except when the truck is stopped or impeded by traffic where stopped by traffic the sound amplifying equipment shall not be operated for longer than one minute at each such stop 4 sound shall not be issued within 100 yards of hospitals schools churches courthouses or public gatherings 5 no sound truck with its amplifying device in operation shall be operated on any street within the congested district or within a business district of the city 6 the human speech and music amplified shall not be profane lewd indecent or slanderous 7 the volume of sound shall be controlled so that it will not be audible for a distance in excess of 100 feet from the sound truck and so that the volume is not unreasonably loud raucous jarring disturbing or a nuisance to persons within the area of audibility 8 no sound amplifying equipment shall be operated in excess of 15 watts of power in the last stage of amplification   03 commercial advertising by sound truck adjacent thereto whether attended or unattended during the hours between sunset and sunrise and there is not sufficient light to reveal any person or object within a distance of 500 feet upon such street or highway such vehicle so parked or stopped shall be equipped with one or more lamps meeting the following requirements at least one lamp shall display a white or amber light visible from a distance of 500 feet to the front of the vehicle and the same lamp or at least one other lamp shall display a red light visible from a distance of 500 feet to the rear of the vehicle and the location of such lamp or lamps shall always be such that at least one lamp or combination of lamps meeting the requirements of this section is installed as near as practicable to the side of the vehicle which is closest to passing traffic the foregoing provisions shall not apply to a motorcycle motordriven cycle or moped c any lighted headlamps upon a parked vehicle shall be depressed or dimmed w va c1515 07 lights on slowmoving vehicles all vehicles including animaldrawn vehicles and including those referred to in c not hereinbefore specifically required to be equipped with lamps shall at the times specified in be equipped with at least one lighted lamp or lantern exhibiting a white light visible from a distance of 500 feet to the front of such vehicle and with a lamp or lantern exhibiting a red light visible from a distance of 500 feet to the rear w va c1516 08 spotlights and auxiliary lights a spot lamps any motor vehicle except a public utility company maintenance vehicle may be equipped left of the prolongation of the extreme left side of the vehicle nor more than 100 feet ahead of the vehicle a public utility company maintenance vehicle may be equipped with more than one spot lamp but all lighted spot lamps shall be aimed and used in conformity to the requirements of this subsection b fog lamps any motor vehicle may be equipped with not to exceed two fog lamps mounted on the front at a height not less than 12 inches nor more than 30 inches above the level surface upon which the vehicle stands and so aimed that when the vehicle is not loaded none of the highintensity portion of the light to the left of the center of the vehicle shall at a distance of 25 feet ahead project higher than a level of four inches below the level of the center of the lamp from which it comes c auxiliary passing lamp any motor vehicle may be equipped with not to exceed one auxiliary passing lamp mounted on the front at a height not less than 24 inches nor more than 42 inches above the level surface upon which the vehicle stands and every auxiliary passing lamp shall meet the requirements and limitations set forth in this d auxiliary driving lamp any motor vehicle may be
