or conflicts with other laws rules and regulations unless the right to do so is preempted or prohibited by the city state or federal government this apply  32 article 1373  planned unit development statement of legislative intent within certain districts now existing or which may hereafter be created it is intended to permit on application and on approval of detailed site and building plans planned unit developments primarily for housing where tracts suitable in location and character for the uses and structures proposed are to be planned and developed as units within such planned unit developments regulations adapted to such unified planning and development are intended to accomplish the purposes of zoning and subdivision regulation to the same degree as in districts in which regulations are desired to control development which is not on a similarly unified basis however it is expressly intended that the planned unit developments provide a method of development for land that permits variation in lot sizes without an increase in the density of population or development that allows subdivisions with varying lot sizes so as to allow home buyers a choice of lot sizes according to their needs that preserves open space tree cover scenic vistas natural drainageways and outstanding natural topography that prevents soil erosion by permitting lot sizes according to the nature of the terrain within the development that provides larger open areas with greater utility for open space and recreation and that encourages the development of more attractive and economic and less monotonous building forms by providing freedom of architectural and site design 01   definitions for purposes of this article a planned unit development which may hereafter be referred to as a pud means 1 land under unified control planned and developed as a whole  2 in a single development operation or a definitely programmed series of development operations including all lands and buildings  3 for dwellings and related subordinate facilities  4 according to comprehensive and detailed plans which include not only streets utilities lots or building sites and the like but also site plans floor plans and elevations for all buildings as intended to be located constructed used and related to each other and detailed plans for other uses and improvements on the land as related to the buildings  and 5 with a program for provision operation and maintenance of such areas improvements and facilities as will be for common use by some or all of the occupants of the development but will not be provided operated or maintained at general public expense 02   permitted locations a puds may hereafter be established by amendments to the official zoning map in any existing residence district where tracts suitable in location and character for the uses and structures proposed are to be planned and developed as units according to the requirements and procedures set forth herein unified tracts of land for puds shall contain a minimum of five acres of land b puds shall be appropriately located with respect to the general pattern of urban development existing or proposed and to public and private facilities and services existing or clearly to be available by the time development reaches the stage where they will be required the following specific requirements shall be met as established in to 137309 03   relation to major transportation facilities puds shall be located with respect to major streets and highways or other transportation facilities so as to provide direct access to such districts without creating traffic along minor streets in residential neighborhoods outside such districts 04   relation to utilities and public facilities puds shall be located in relation to sanitary sewers water lines storm and surface drainage systems and other utilities systems and installations so that neither extension nor enlargement of such systems will be required in manner form character location degree scale of timing resulting in higher net public cost or earlier incursion of public cost than would development in a form generally permitted in the area such districts shall be located with respect to schools parks playgrounds and other public facilities required so as to have access in the same degree as would development in a form generally permitted in the area 05   physical character of site  relation to surrounding property the site shall be suitable for development in the manner proposed without hazards to persons or property on or off the site from probability of flooding erosion subsidence or slipping of the soil or other dangers annoyances or inconveniences condition of soil groundwater level drainage and topography shall be appropriate to both kind and pattern of use intended 06   permitted uses a any use permitted in an r1 district shall be permitted in a pud any use permissible in an r1 district by special permit shall be similarly permissible in a pud b any residential use shall be permitted in a pud provided that the maximum family density per acre contained in the pud is not more than the maximum family density required in the zoning district or districts in which the development is located c in addition facilities planned for development as a part of such district and serving needs not otherwise served in the general area in which the district is located including service commercial and office facilities shall be permitted provided that such facilities and the structures and areas occupied are located and designed so as to protect the character of the district and the desirable character of surrounding property and shall not in combination occupy more than five percent of the area of the district 07   application procedure a filing applications shall be filed with the municipal planning commission as provided in to 137507 b municipal planning commission action 1 the municipal planning commission shall consider the application hold a public hearing and report its findings to council such report need not be made within 30 days after submission of the application but shall be made within 60 days after the applicant requests that such report be made 2 commission recommendations include a findings as to suitability of the area for pud development  b the kind of nonresidential facilities if any which appear appropriately related to the housing in the particular case which might be permitted within the development with appropriate restrictions  c specific suggestions for modifications of provisions of general subdivision zoning or other regulations or of guides and standards for planned unit developments where the commission finds that circumstances justify such modification and that the proposed modification serves public purposes to the same degree as the existing provisions  d approval or disapproval of specific items plans programs or instruments proposed by the applicant 08   expiration of time limit on amendments a if building development required in the amendments is not taken within such time limits as are set by council in its amending action the municipal planning commission shall review the circumstances and recommend to council that 1 pud zoning for the entire area is to be continued with revised time limits or 2 pud zoning for part of the area is to be continued with revised time limits and the remainder rezoned to an appropriate category or 3 that the entire area is to be rezoned from pud to an appropriate category or 4 such other action taken as appears proper in the circumstances of the case b in such recommendation shall be included suggestions as to related action appropriate in the case with respect to any instruments involved 09   article 1375  group housing projects group housing projects this article establishes standards for group housing projects a group housing project for purposes of this zoning any structure or series of structures of 1 singlefamily dwelling units  2 two or more apartment buildings  or 3 three or more attached singlefamily row dwellings where there is no intent to subdivide for sale of individual lots or buildings 01   legislative intent  purpose this article is intended to provide certainty and flexibility in the application of this zoning the construction of group housing projects which because of their nature raise special questions concerning placement bulk and the interrelationship between buildings within such projects as well as other problems nothing in this uses or construction contrary to use density or other limitations for the district in which the project is located and is contained in other provisions of this  02   unauthorized projects forbidden the construction of a group housing project except according to a plan approved as provided in this article is forbidden 03   application procedure a plan to be filed with planning commission applications for construction of group housing projects shall be filed with the planning commission b application requirements an application for approval of a group housing project shall be accompanied by an application fee of $5000 and an overall development plan which must include at least the following 1 a site map or maps drawn to scale showing a proposed finished grades with contour intervals of two feet  b proposed street system including driveways curb cuts and parking areas  c proposed location of buildings fences plantings pedestrian walkways and open areas  d proposed location of any external lighting and signs  e location of essential services 2 a tabulation of a total area of the premises  b area of usable land  c area of land proposed for streets  d area of land per dwelling unit  e area of land devoted to open space 3 a vicinity map showing the location of the site in relation to surrounding neighborhood 4 architectural sketches at an appropriate scale showing building height bulk external layout and proposed use 5 a statement listing and fully explaining the specific modifications of the provisions of this zoning are necessary 6 a tentative time schedule of the stages of development and the tentative date of completion of the project c applicant financial ability applicants filing plans required by this demonstrate financial capacity to complete the buildings and structures proposed within a reasonable time after approval is given 04   standards for review the planning commission shall review any plans filed according to the following standards 1 general conformity to zoning plan shall demonstrate that the proposed uses shall conform to those permitted in the district that the open spaces provided will at least equal the minimums required in the district that offstreet parking and loading facilities meet the requirements of this that all other general or special requirements of this complied with 2 traffic the plan shall make adequate provision for the safe and convenient movement of vehicular and pedestrian traffic within the site plan to and from adjacent streets and to and from highways 3 utilities and similar concerns the plan shall demonstrate adequate access to necessary utilities provision for essential services and adequate provision for drainage waste disposal and exterior elimination 4 neighboring property the plan shall demonstrate that light heat glare or any other use or activity on the property subject to the plan will not adversely affect neighboring property nor discourage orderly development of adjacent properties in keeping with uses permitted in the districts 05   commission action the commission shall approve the plan request modification of the plan or disapprove the plan if the plan is approved or if requested modifications are made by the applicant and approved by the commission the plan shall be filed with the building official and construction of the project may proceed according to the plan 06   minor adjustment following approval after approval of the plan minor changes may be made with the approval of the building official if such changes do not 1 increase the ratio of gross floor area in structures to the total area of the premises  2 change the nature of intensity of the use  3 reduce substantially open spaces between buildings or setbacks from lot lines  4 increase external effects on adjacent properties  5 reduce offstreet parking or loading spaces  or 6 change substantially any provisions for essential services 07   article 1379  cluster development legislative intent the purposes of cluster development are to provide a method of development for land that permits variation in lot sizes without an increase in the density of population or development that allows subdivisions with varying lot sizes so as to allow home buyers a choice of lot sizes according to their needs that preserves open space tree cover scenic vistas natural drainageways and outstanding natural topography that prevents soil erosion by permitting lot sizes according to the nature of the terrain within the development that provides larger open areas with greater utility for rest and recreation and that encourages the development of more attractive and economic and less monotonous building forms by providing freedom of architectural and site design in order to achieve these purposes the municipal planning commission shall have the same administrative authority as in 01   appendix a  table of area yard requirements and building height zone category permitted uses net lot when used in this shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning flammable liquids as used in this article means gasoline petrol kerosene naphtha coal oil or other volatile liquids of like nature gasoline means the liquid derived from petroleum or natural gas commonly known and sold as gasoline and distillate benzene benzol naphtha liberty fuel casing head absorption and natural gasoline and such other volatile and flammable liquids produced or compounded for the purpose of operating or propelling gasoline engines or which is useable for such purpose   01 permit required a necessity for permit for storage tank no person shall construct or install any storage tank for flammable liquids within the city without first obtaining from council a permit thereof b application the applicant for such permit shall file with council an application showing the location of such storage tank together with plans and specifications of such tanks c issuance upon the approval of such application by council the building official shall issue a permit to construct or install a storage tank in accordance therewith d revocation a permit for the construction or installation of such storage tank may be revoked by council 925  02 gasoline storage  kerosene and coal oil a gasoline storage no person shall keep in or about his premises more than ten gallons of flammable liquids any flammable liquids so kept shall be kept in a closed container and away from heat fires flames and rubbish no person or persons may sell buy or store gasoline in glass containers b kerosene and coal oil storage no merchant shall keep kerosene or coal oil in a quantity greater than 125 gallons this quantity or less may be kept only when stored in closed steel tanks or barrels in good leakproof condition one foam fire extinguisher of halfgallon size for each tank or barrel used for the storage of flammable liquids shall be provided and in place ready for use at all times  927  03 highly flammable liquids  storage a no merchant shall keep gasoline or other liquids more flammable than common coal oil in about or upon his premises unless such is stored in approved steel tanks of a capacity not exceeding 600 gallons each such tanks shall be buried beneath the ground a minimum depth of two feet and covered over with a concrete slab six inches thick and as large as the surface area of the pit in which the tank is buried this concrete slab may be omitted and the tanks be buried not less than three feet below the surface of the ground filler pipes shall have locking caps and shall be carried outside all buildings and the ends placed at least five feet from any door or exit opening in addition one foam fire extinguisher of one gallon capacity shall be provided and placed ready for use at all times for each tank so used for the storage of flammable liquids b no person may keep flammable liquids in quantities greater than 600 gallons except in tanks approved by the underwriters laboratories inc and without first obtaining the consent of council which council shall first refer the matter to the chief of the city fire department for his consideration the chief shall consider the safety of the area resident property and other fire conditions in making his report to council as to whether such consent shall be given  929  04 gasoline dealers  storage requirements gasoline in any quantity in excess of 2200 gallons shall not be kept stored or maintained by any person at any location or on any parcel of land on which is located any structure station or pumps used for the sale of gasoline at retail commonly known as filling stations or service stations nor shall any tank or tanks of an aggregate capacity of more than 2200 gallons be so kept or maintained no person operating such filling station or service station shall use any land or premises adjoining or in close proximity thereto for the purpose of storing an additional quantity of gasoline for sale at retail   05 tank cars  portable tanks a no person shall unload a tank car or portion thereof into a retail outlet where gasoline is received and stored for retail purposes b no portable tank or tank truck used for transporting or hauling flammable liquids shall be stored in an oil warehouse or a public garage  9212  06 open flame precautions no open flame heating or lighting device shall be used in any room where gasoline or other volatile flammable fluids are stored or handled   07 transporting and storing explosives no quantity of explosives shall be transported kept or stored within the city without a permit issued by the city manager and the fire chief   08 penalty editors note see for general 171502 duties of the department regulations pursuant to the provisions of w va ch 29 the department shall adopt rules and regulations of the west virginia contractors licensing board relating to the following the minimum qualifications for applicants for license in each of the following specified classes of contractor as defined in definitions 1 electrical contractor  2 general building contractor  3 handyman contractor  4 heating ventilating and cooling contractor  5 low voltage contractor  6 piping contractor  7 plumbing contractor  8 specialty contractor 4  171503 necessity for license  exemptions a on or after  no person shall engage in any act as a contractor as defined in this unless such person holds a license issued under the provisions of this firm partnership corporation association or other entity shall engage in contracting in this city unless an officer thereof holds a license issued pursuant to this b any person to whom a license has been issued under this keep the license or a copy thereof posted in a conspicuous position at every construction site where work is being done by the contractor the contractors license number shall be included in all contracting advertisements and all fully executed and binding contracts any person violating the provisions of this subsection shall be subject after hearing to a warning a reprimand or a fine of not more than $20000 c except as otherwise provided in this the following are exempt from licensure 1 work done exclusively by employees of the united states government the state of west virginia a county city or municipal corporation and any governmental subdivision or agency thereof  2 the sale or installation of a finished product material or article of merchandise which is not actually fabricated into and does not become a permanent fixed part of the structure or property  3 work performed personally by an owner or lessee of real property on property the primary use of which is for agricultural or farming enterprise  4 a material supplier who renders advice concerning use of products sold and who does not provide construction or installation services  5 work performed by a public utility company regulated by the west virginia public service commission and its employees  6 repair work contracted for by the owner of the equipment  7 work performed by an employers regular employees for which the employees are paid regular wages and not a contract price on business property owned or leased by the employer  8 work personally performed on a structure by the owner or occupant thereof  and 9 work performed when the specifications for such work have been developed or approved by engineering personnel employed by the owner of a facility by registered professional engineers licensed pursuant to the laws of this state when the work to be performed because of its specialized nature or process cannot be reasonably or timely contracted for within the general area of the facility 4  171504 application for and issuance of license a any person holding a business registration certificate to conduct business in west virginia as a contractor and desiring to be licensed as a contractor in the city shall submit to the department a written application requesting licensure providing all information as the department may require on forms supplied by the department and shall pay the applicable license fee determined by the department not to exceed $15000 and shall be issued a contractors license without further examination b any person desiring a license shall at the time of application pay the annual fee as established by the department except that in the case of a sole proprietorship conducting business only as an electrical contractor where the business owner holds a master electricians license issued under the provisions of w va b4 and provides proof thereof to the department the annual fee is $2500 c a license issued under the provisions of this valid from july 1 to june 30 the citys fiscal year d the holder of a valid license may renew the license on or before the expiration date making renewal application on forms provided by the department and paying the appropriate fee as set by the department if the renewal application is received or postmarked more than 15 days after the expiration date the applicant is required to pay in addition to the annual renewal fee a penalty fee of $5000  provided that no license which has lapsed for a period of two years or more may be renewed a renewal of a license may be conditional by action of the department under the provisions of w va  4  171505 licenses  fees  renewal the department may promulgate rules and regulations pursuant to the provisions of w va ch 29a concerning license renewal  provided that the rules may not be more restrictive than those prescribed for initial licensure 4  171506 unlawful use assignment transfer of license  revocation no license may be used for any purpose by any person other than the person to whom the license is issued no license may be assigned transferred or otherwise disposed of so as to permit the unauthorized use thereof any person who violates this section is subject to the penalties imposed in of this 4  171507 prerequisites to obtaining building permit any person making application to the building shall issue a cease and desist order requiring such person to immediately cease all operations in the city the order shall be withdrawn upon issuance of a license to such person after a hearing the appeal board may impose a penalty of not less than $20000 nor more than $100000 upon any person engaging in contracting business without a valid license b any person continuing to engage in contracting business without a valid license after service of a cease and desist order is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined not less than $20000 nor more than $500000 or imprisoned in the county jail not more than 30 days or both fined and imprisoned c the department may institute proceedings in the municipal court of the city of hurricane or putnam county circuit court alleging the violations of the provisions of this article which occurred or are now occurring to enjoin any violation of any provision of this d any person who undertakes any construction work without a valid license when such license is required by this article when the total cost of the contractors construction contract on any project upon which the work is undertaken is $2500000 or more shall in addition to any other penalty herein provided be assessed by the board an administrative penalty not to exceed $20000 per day for each day the person is in violation e the department shall by regulation provide for an administrative hearing before a penalty is levied and for review of any final ruling issued pursuant to such hearing 4  171510 disciplinary powers of the department a the department has the power and authority to impose the following disciplinary actions 1 permanently revoke a license  2 suspend a license for a specified period  3 censure or reprimand a licensee  4 impose limitations or conditions on the professional practice of a licensee  5 impose requirements for remedial professional education to correct deficiencies in the education training and skill of a licensee  and 6 impose a probationary period requiring a licensee to report regularly to the board on matters related to the grounds for probation  the board may withdraw probationary status if the deficiencies that required the sanction are remedied b the department may summarily suspend a licensee pending a hearing or pending an appeal after hearing upon a determination that the licensee poses a clear significant and immediate danger to the public health and safety c the department may reinstate the suspended or revoked license of a person if upon a hearing the board finds and determines that such person is able to practice with skill and safety d the department may accept the voluntary surrender of a license  provided that such license may not be reissued unless the board determines that the licensee is competent to resume practice and the licensee pays the appropriate renewal fee e a person or contractor adversely affected by disciplinary action may appeal to the department within 60 days of the date such disciplinary action is taken the appeal board shall hear the appeal within 15 days from receipt of notice of appeal in accordance with the provisions of w va ch 29a the department may retain a hearing examiner to conduct the hearings and present proposed findings of fact and conclusions of law to the board for its action f any party adversely affected by any action of the board may appeal such action pursuant to the provisions of w va ch 29a g the following are causes for disciplinary action 1 abandonment without legal excuse of any construction project or operation engaged in or undertaken by the licensee  2 willful failure or refusal to complete a construction project or operation with reasonable diligence thereby causing material injury to another  3 willful departure from or disregard of plans or specifications in any material respect without the consent of the parties to the contract  4 willful or deliberate violation of the building code laws or regulations of the state or of the city  5 willful or deliberate failure to pay any monies when due for any materials free from defect or services rendered in connection with such persons operations as a contractor when such person has the capacity to pay or when such person has received sufficient funds under the contract as payment for the particular construction work for which the services or materials were rendered or purchased or the fraudulent denial of any amount with intent to injure delay or defraud the person to whom the debt is owed  6 willful or deliberate misrepresentation of a material fact by an applicant or licensee in obtaining a license or in connection with official licensing matters  7 willful or deliberate failure to comply in any material respect with the provisions of this the rules of the department  8 willfully or deliberately acting in the capacity of a contractor when not licensed or as a contractor by a person other than the person to whom the license is issued except as an employee of the licensee  9 willfully or deliberately acting with the intent to evade the provisions of this a aiding or abetting an unlicensed person to evade the provisions of this   b combining or conspiring with an unlicensed person to perform an unauthorized act  c allowing a license to be used by an unlicensed person  or d attempting to assign transfer or otherwise dispose of a license or permitting the unauthorized use thereof  10 engaging in any willful fraudulent or deceitful act in the capacity as a contractor whereby substantial injury is sustained by another  or 11 performing work which is not commensurate with a general standard of the specific classification of contractor or which is below a building or construction code adopted by the city or county in which the work is performed h in all disciplinary hearings the appeal board has the burden of proof as to all matters in contention except for violations of this section no disciplinary action shall be taken unless the licensee has been finally adjudicated as having perpetrated such act in a court of record other than as specifically set out herein the department shall have no power or authority to impose or assess damages 4  171511 administrative duties of department for and on behalf of the city the department shall perform the following administrative duties 1 may be imposed by the state of west virginia or by the city 4  171512 rules the department may adopt rules and regulations as are necessary to carry out the provisions of this to the provisions of w va ch 29a the department may disseminate educational or any other material designed to improve performance standards of a contractor group to contractors within the state 4  171513 recordkeeping a the department shall keep a record of all actions taken and account for monies received b the department shall maintain at its principal office open for public inspection during office hours a complete indexed record of all applications licenses issued licenses renewed and all revocations cancellations and suspensions of licenses applications shall show the date of application name qualifications place of business and place of residence of each applicant  and whether the application was approved or refused c 1 all investigations complaints reports records proceedings and other information received by the department and related to complaints made to the department or investigations conducted by the department pursuant to this including the identity of the complainant or respondent shall be confidential and shall not be knowingly and improperly disclosed by any member or former member of the department except as follows a upon a finding that probable cause exists to believe that a respondent has violated the provisions of this the complaint and all reports records nonprivileged and nondeliberative materials introduced at any probable cause hearing held pursuant to the complaint are thereafter not confidential  provided that confidentiality of such information shall remain in full force and effect until the respondent has been served with a copy of the statement of charges b any subsequent hearing held in the matter for the purpose of receiving evidence or the arguments of the parties or their representatives shall be open to the public and all reports records and nondeliberative materials introduced into evidence at such subsequent hearing as well as the departments orders are not confidential c the department may release any information relating to an investigation at any time if the release has been agreed to in writing by the respondent d the complaint as well as the identity of the complainant shall be disclosed to a person named as respondent in any such complaint filed immediately upon such respondents request e where the department is otherwise required by the provisions of this article to disclose such information or to proceed in such a manner that disclosure is necessary and required to fulfill such requirements 2 if in a specific case the department finds that there is a reasonable likelihood that the dissemination of information or opinion in connection with a pending or imminent proceeding will interfere with a fair hearing or otherwise prejudice the due administration of justice the department shall order that all or a portion of the information communicated to the department to cause an investigation and all allegations of violations or misconduct contained in a complaint shall be confidential and the person providing such information or filing a complaint shall be bound to confidentiality until further order of the department d if any person violates the provisions of subsection c of this section by knowingly and willfully disclosing any information made confidential by such section or by the department such person shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined not less than $50000 nor more than $500000 e the building official shall certify to the recorder and to the council a detailed statement of all monies received and spent during the preceding fiscal year 4  171514 cease and desist orders a upon a determination that a person is engaged in a contracting business in this state without a valid license the building official shall issue a cease and desist order requiring such person to immediately cease all operations in this city the order shall be withdrawn after such person pays a $10000 fee or double permit whichever is greater after an administrative hearing as provided for in this the appeal board may impose a penalty of not less than $20000 nor more than $100000 upon any person engaging in a contracting business without a valid license b any person continuing to engage in a contracting business in this state without a valid license after the service of a cease and desist order is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined not less than $20000 nor more than $500000 the department may institute proceedings in the circuit court of the county in which the alleged violations of w va  et seq and the provisions of this or are now occurring to enjoin any such violation c any person who undertakes any construction work without a valid license when such license is required by w va  et seq when the total cost of the contractors construction contract on any project upon which the work is undertaken is $2500000 or more shall in addition to any other penalty herein provided be assessed by the department an administrative penalty not to exceed $20000 per day for each day the person is in violation d the appeal board shall provide for an administrative hearing before a penalty is assessed 4  171515 administrative hearings a any person adversely affected by any action of the department may appeal to the appeal board within 60 days of such action the appeal board shall hear the appeal within 15 days from receipt of notice of appeal in accordance with the provisions of w va a51 et seq within five days of receipt of a request for hearing the appeal board shall provide a notice containing the date time and place of the hearing and a short and plain statement of the matters asserted b the appeal board may employ a hearing examiner to conduct the hearings and present proposed findings of fact and conclusions of law to the board for its action c the appeal board shall provide a written final decision to the aggrieved person within 30 days of the close of the hearing the final decision of the appeal board is subject to judicial review by the circuit court of competent jurisdiction any such appeal shall be filed with the court within 30 days of the date of the final decision of the appeal board 4  171516 reciprocity to the extent that other states counties or municipalities which provide for the licensing of contractors provide for similar action the department in its discretion may grant licenses of the same or equivalent classification to contractors upon satisfactory proof furnished to the department that the qualifications of such applicants are equal to the qualifications of holders of similar licenses in this city and in accordance with of this 4  171517 article 1717  moving of buildings definitions as used in this building or structure shall be construed to include any building structure or mobile home regardless of its composition present or intended use the horizontal or vertical dimensions of which are greater than ten feet mover means the person firm or corporation engaged in the actual transportation of the structure involved as distinguished from the owner of the real property to or from which the structure in question is to be moved 01   permit required  fee no person shall move any building structure or mobile home over or upon the streets alleys or sidewalks of the city without applying for and obtaining a permit from the building official at such time as the building official shall cause any such permit to issue a minimum fee of $10000 shall be assessed against the applicant and paid by the applicant to the recorder council may assess such fee or fees in an amount or amounts higher than such minimum as it may see fit to require in consideration of the work to be performed of city employees in conjunction with the processing investigation issuance inspection and supervision that is incurred for and by reason of the issuance of such permits 02   application  investigations application for such permit shall be made upon forms supplied by the recorder to be signed by both the mover and owner of the real property involved the recorder shall then refer the same to the building official the building official shall thereupon inspect or cause to be inspected both the structure as well as the land site or sites to be affected should such permit thereafter issue and report his findings and recommendations no later than the second regular meeting of council following the date of the transmittal of the application to the building official 03   issuance  bond the action of the building official in issuing or denying any such permit shall be in accordance with uniform city standards and any such permit granted may be upon such conditions precedent and subsequent as the building official may deem proper for the protection of persons and property both private and public council may require bond with corporate surety of its designation in such an amount as it may require conditioned to indemnify protect and save harmless the city and any and all other persons firms or corporations from any and all damage to persons or property arising out of or caused by the act of moving the structure in question and for the faithful performance of all other conditions imposed in consideration of the issuance of the permit and no such permit shall issue until such bond as so conditioned and approved by the city solicitor shall be filed with the city clerk 04   penalty whoever moves any building or structure over or upon the streets alleys or sidewalks of the city without first obtaining a permit or in violation of any condition contained in such permit shall be fined not more than $100000 99   article 1719  911 addressing and mapping  street names  building numbers applicability a the provisions of building in accordance to this owner shall place or cause to be placed upon each house or building controlled by him the number or numbers assigned under the uniform number system within 30 days of notification of the assigned address the cost of posting the address shall be the responsibility of the property owner b filing application for an address assignment the owner shall file an application for an address assignment with the hurricane addressing coordinator the address must be issued not later than 60 days following identification of address and installed on the structure prior to final inspection by the city of hurricane building official c display of number residential structure each primary structure must display the number of the address assigned to that address the street number for residences shall be in accordance with the international property maintenance premises identification the numbers shall be placed on above or at the side of the main entrance so the number is clearly visible from the public rightofway  a number shall also be placed at the end of a driveway or property entrance address numbers are to be a contrasting color to the background on which they are mounted d affixing the number the owner or person in charge of any house building mobile home or other structure to which a number has been assigned shall affix the number as outlined in this days after receipt or notification of such number e display of number commercial and industrial structure address numbers for commercial and industrial structures must follow the international property maintenance number must be placed above or on the main entrance to the structure when possible if such number is not clearly visible from the public rightofway the number must be placed along a driveway or on a sign visible from the same address numbers are to be a contrasting color to the background on which they are mounted f display of number 1 apartments and similar the address number assigned to a single building number shall be displayed on each assigned structure following the boca pm 3033 code numbers andor letters for individual apartments or units within these complexes must be displayed on above or to the side of the main doorway of each apartment or unit it shall be the responsibility of the property owner to affix apartment or unit numbers 2 trailer park and similar the address number assigned to a trailer within an organized trailer park must be one address number for the trailer park with each trailer assigned a lot or space number the lot or space number must be posted and permanently affixed to the lot identifying the lot or space number the main address to the trailer park must be posted at the entrance of the park address numbers are to be a contrasting color to the background on which they are mounted g official address the combination of such an address number and the road or street name must be the official address of such primary structure h costs all costs to individuals households or businesses in complying with this section of this be borne by that individual household or business  2172004 road naming a the putnam county road name index is to be the official listing of names for streets and roads in putnam county b no street within the city of hurricane may be assigned a name on a subdivision plat or otherwise until such name is registered with the hurricane addressing coordinator approved and added to the putnam county road name index the city of hurricane council or the duly authorized agent shall have the authority to refuse registration of any name already in use confusingly similar to a name already registered deemed confusing for purposes of emergency response or deemed inappropriate by the hurricane city council c no street name currently shown on a subdivision plat filed with the city of hurricane or otherwise shall be implemented by a subdivision owner until such name has been registered approved and added to the putnam county road name index the hurricane city addressing coordinator shall have the authority to refuse registration of any name already in use confusingly similar to a name already registered deemed confusing for purposes of emergency response or deemed inappropriate by the hurricane city council d road names may not duplicate road names already assigned irrespective of road name prefixes or suffixes except for roads located within different corporations e a street name may not be differentiated using the same name by changing the street suffix such as a street or avenue f a street may have only one name throughout its entire length unless approved as an exception by the hurricane city council  2172004 street signs a all new street signs erected within the city of hurricane must be in conformance with the specifications of this section unless the west virginia department of transportation division of highways or the city of hurricane grants a variance b the owner of any subdivision or other development shall erect or cause to be erected street signs in conformance with this any and all intersections within such subdivisions or development upon construction of any street on or after the effective date of this unless by vote of the city of hurricane such responsibility is assumed by the city of hurricane or its duly authorized agent where any subdivision owner is currently required to erect street signs but has failed to do so the future erection of street signs shall be in conformance with this c sign specifications all signs erected shall be in conformance at minimum to west virginia department of transportation division of highways specifications as defined in the standards for the design and installation of road name signing published march 1999 d signage which is damaged or destroyed shall be the responsibility of the individuals causing such damage or destruction whether by negligence or otherwise the agency or individuals responsible for maintenance of the damaged sign shall have the authority to recover the cost of replacing the sign from the individuals causing such damage or destruction  2172004 appeals section of this be deemed a misdemeanor punishable by a fine of not to exceed $50000 each day a violation continues shall constitute a separate offense b whenever the city of hurricanes duly authorized agent has reason to believe there has been or there exists a violation of this the council shall give written notice of such violation to the person failing to comply and order the person to take corrective measures within 30 days from of notification if such persons fail to comply with the duly issued order the council of the city of hurricane shall initiate necessary actions to terminate the violation hurricane municipal court  2172004 article 1721  building inspector adoption a as previously approved by city council on  w va b as promulgated by the west virginia state fire of this 1 article 1723  vacant building registration and regulation 172301  purpose authority and authorization a the purpose of this article shall be to establish a system of registration and regulation of vacant buildings to aid the city in the verification and management of said vacant buildings in order to protect and promote the public health safety and welfare of the residents of the city and to provide for the elimination of hazards to public health and safety b the provisions of this be in addition to and not in lieu of methods or processes otherwise permitted or authorized in any ordinance or law of the city county or the state of west virginia nothing in this preclude the city from utilizing any existing or later created legal remedy that may be available to it to protect the health safety and welfare of its residents or to enforce the ordinances and statutes applicable within the city c the city is authorized under state law to create and establish a vacant building registration program pursuant to west virginia c d this be construed liberally to the extent permitted under west virginia law in order to achieve the purposes and intent set forth herein e the city council hereby authorizes the city officers to act in conformity with the terms and conditions of this with state law  172302  definitions as used in this the following terms are defined as follows a city shall mean the city of hurricane west virginia b notice address shall mean the address maintained by the assessor of putnam county west virginia in connection with the ad valorem tax tickets assigned to a property c occupied or occupying shall mean being in present use or the use of a structure for its intended purpose by persons on a consistent basis over time the terms occupied or occupying do not include use by unauthorized persons trespassers or illegal activity for purposes of this evidence offered to prove a structure is occupied may include but shalt not be limited to the receipt of delivery of regular mail us postal service  evidence demonstrating the delivery of and payment for some or all of telephone cable internet electric gas heating water and sewer services for a period of not less than 180 days without interruptions of more than 30 days at a time  a valid city business license or recent federal state or city income tax statements indicating that the subject structure is the official personal or business residence of any owner persons or businesses claiming occupancy of the subject structure d owner shall mean the person assessed as the owner of a property by the assessor of putnam county west virginia e person shall mean a natural person or a firm trust corporation association partnership limited liability company limited partnership public entity joint venture or any other kind of entity or enterprise whether or not incorporated or certificated with any public body of any kind or character f premises shall mean a lot plot or parcel of real property upon which any vacant building is situated g property shall mean any parcel of real property or any right or interest in real property that is identifiable of record with the putnam county clerk west virginia h structure shall mean any building that is intended to be or that was originally intended to be occupied i vacant building shall mean a structure that is not occupied for 90 consecutive days vacant building shall not include those structures that are currently under construction or being renovated and those structures exempt from this to  172303  owner registration required a each owner of every vacant building located within the city shall register the subject vacant building with the city by filing with the city a registration form promulgated under the terms of this b if any owner of the subject vacant building is an individual the registration statement shall include the street address and parcel number of the subject vacant building the name and resident address of the individual and any other information deemed necessary by the city c if any owner of the subject vacant building is a corporation the registration statement shall include the street address and parcel number of the subject vacant building the names and resident addresses of all officers and directors of the corporation and any other information deemed necessary by the city d if any owner of the subject vacant building is an estate the registration statement shall include the street address and parcel number of the subject vacant building the name and resident address of the executor of the estate and any other information deemed necessary by the city e if any owner of the subject vacant building is a trust the registration statement shall include the street address and parcel number of the subject vacant building the names and resident addresses of all trustees grantors and beneficiaries and any other information deemed necessary by the city f if any owner of the subject vacant building is a partnership the registration statement shall include the street address and parcel number of the subject vacant building the names and resident addresses of all the partners with an interest of ten percent or greater and any other information deemed necessary by the city g if any owner of the subject vacant building is any other form of unincorporated association the registration statement shall include the street address and parcel number of the subject vacant building the names and resident addresses of all principals and any other information deemed necessary by the city h if any owner of the subject vacant building resides outside of the state of west virginia any owner shall provide the name and address of a person that resides within the state of west virginia who is their agent who is authorized to accept service of process and notice of fees or fines due under this behalf of any owner and who is designated as a local agent for the purposes of notification in the event of an emergency affecting the public health safety or welfare  172304  penalty for failure to register a it shall be a violation of this any owner of a vacant building that is required to be registered under the terms of this fail to register the subject vacant building within 30 days upon receipt of the required notice as set forth in a b it shall be a violation of this any new owner of a vacant building that remains a vacant building to fail to register the subject vacant building under the terms of this days of the change in ownership c any failure of any owner to register each vacant building shall constitute a separate violation of this shall result in a fine against that owner of not more than $100000 per violation each and every 12 month period following the application of a fine under this be a separate violation of this may result in additional fines of not more than $100000 per violation d the city building inspector shall be responsible for assessing all fines according the requirements and procedures of this  172305  investigations  determining structures not occupied a city building inspector the city building inspector acting in his official capacity as agent of the city is hereby authorized to make lawful and reasonable inspections examinations or observations of any structure for the purpose of determining whether the same may be a vacant building b inspection examination or observation the authorization of the city building inspector set forth in subsection a shall be limited to inspection examination or observation between  am and  pm the city building inspector shall carry proper identification as all times when inspecting examining or observing any structure under the terms of this  172306  notice of structure found to be a vacant building a required notice if the city building inspector has identified an unregistered vacant building the city building inspector shall cause notice to be delivered to the notice address of the property owner on which the vacant building is situated by certified mail return receipt requested if for any reason such certified mail is returned without evidence of proper receipt thereof then the city building inspector shall cause a class i0 legal advertisement to be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city and shall cause notice to be posted on the front door or other conspicuous location on the vacant building or property b form of notice when under the requirements of this notice is to be sent the notice shall include at least the following information 1 a description of the property on which the vacant building is situated sufficient to identify the property  2 a statement that the vacant building has been identified by the city to be in violation of this   3 a statement that any owner may dispute the determination by contacting the city building inspector not less than 30 days from the date of the notice  4 a statement that the failure of any owner to contact the city or the failure to register the vacant building pursuant to this result in the assessment of a fine pursuant to   5 a statement that the city may file a notice of lien with the clerk of the county commission of putnam county west virginia andor may bring a civil action in the circuit court of putnam county west virginia to enforce assessed fines or fees under this   and 6 a statement that any owner has the right to appeal the determination of the city to the circuit court of putnam county west virginia  172307  assessment of fees a fee assessment there is hereby assessed and shall be collected an annual fee against any owner of each and every vacant building registered with the city as determined by the following scale 1 a fee of $30000 shall be imposed upon any owner of a vacant building where the vacant building was last occupied at least 12 months but less than 24 months since last occupancy  2 a fee of $60000 shall be imposed upon any owner of a vacant building where the vacant building was last occupied at least 24 months but less than 36 months since last occupancy  3 a fee of $90000 shall be imposed upon any owner of a vacant building where the vacant building was last occupied at least 36 months but less than 48 months since last occupancy  4 a fee of $120000 shall be imposed upon any owner of a vacant building where the vacant building was last occupied at least 48 months but less than 60 months since last occupancy  5 a fee of $150000 shall be imposed upon any owner of a vacant building where the vacant building was last occupied at least 60 months but less than 72 months since last occupancy  and 6 a fee of $180000 shall be imposed upon any owner of a vacant building where the vacant building was last occupied more than 72 months since last occupancy b fee assessment date for purposes of determining the fees for registration owed under this only for that purpose the date of last occupancy shall be the first day in which the vacant building was registered pursuant to this the first day in which a fine was assessed for failure to register the vacant building whichever date is earlier any owner asserting that a registered vacant building was occupied after that date has the burden of establishing by adequate proof that occupancy occurred on a later date  172308  collection of fees or fines a statement the city clerk shall be charged with the duty of mailing a statement to any owner charged with vacant building registration fees or fines pursuant to this said fees or fines accrue but failure to mail a statement for said charges shall not be grounds for avoiding payment b notice the city clerk shall cause notice to be sent to the notice address of any owner of vacant buildings which are delinquent in the payment of required vacant building registration fees or fines imposed pursuant to this or any portion thereof by certified mail return receipt requested and shall cause notice to be posted on the front door or other conspicuous location on the structure or property c form of notice when under the requirements of this notice is to be sent the notice shall include at least the following information 1 a description of the property in which the vacant building is situated sufficient to identify the property  2 a statement that delinquent vacant building registration fees or fines were assessed by ordinance and are delinquent  3 a statement that payment of such delinquent vacant building registration fees or fines are to be paid not less than 30 days from the date of the notice  4 a statement that the city may file a notice of lien against the property on which the vacant building is situated if payment is not received in a timely fashion  5 a statement that the city may bring a civil action in the circuit court of putnam county west virginia to enforce payment and collection of such delinquent vacant building registration fees or fines imposed  and 6 a statement that any owner has the right to appeal to the circuit court of putnam county west virginia  172309  liability  remedies and city fund a liability of owner any owner of the vacant building shall be personally liable to the city for said vacant building registration fees or fines imposed pursuant to this b remedies of city for the purpose of collecting delinquent vacant building registration fees or fines assessed pursuant to this the city may impose the following remedies 1 lien against real property the city shall have a lien upon the property on which a vacant building is situated any improvements thereon and any appurtenances thereunto belonging and upon the interest of the owner therein to secure the payment of any fines or fees due owing or imposed under this city acting officers may file a notice of lien with the clerk of the county commission of putnam county against such property in a form sufficient to be recorded and provide notice of the citys lien as described in this section and provided for by west virginia law 2 civil action the city acting officers may bring a civil action in the circuit court of putnam county west virginia to a enforce payment and collection of delinquent vacant building registration fees or fines assessed pursuant to this   or b seek the judicially ordered sale of the property to satisfy its lien c vacant building registration fund the city shall deposit all vacant building registration fees or fines collected pursuant to this a separate account the city shall use such funds to improve public safety efforts including for police and fire personnel  monitor and administer this   and repair close or demolish a vacant building as authorized by west virginia in accordance with of the codified ordinances of the city as amended which pertains to the adoption of the state building  172310  right to appeal any owner or other person aggrieved by any determination made by the city pursuant to this have the right to challenge said determination to the circuit court of putnam county west virginia  172311  exemption from vacant building status a any owner of a vacant building may formally request the city to exempt the subject structure from the registration provisions of the city shall upon a finding for good cause by the city building inspector that any owner of the structure will be unable to occupy the structure for a determinant period of time exempt any owner from the registration provisions of a finding for good cause may be established if any owner can demonstrate that due to facts or circumstances that differentiate this structure the requirements of this a special or undue hardship that is unique or unduly burdensome to this specific structure b all property owned by the united states of america the state of west virginia putnam county west virginia and the city is exempt from the requirements of this  172312  forms the city building inspector and the city clerk shall develop forms or procedures as deemed by them to be necessary to carry forth the requirements of this but not necessarily limited to the requirements pertaining to investigations notice findings and procedures registration and the collection of fees or fines  172313  compliance with other code provisions in no instance shall compliance with this any owner of any vacant building from compliance with all other city west virginia including but not limited to building and housing code provisions and requirements  172314  severability the provisions of this declared to be severable and if any sentence clause or phrase of this for any reason be held to be invalid or unconstitutional such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining sentences clauses and phrases of this they shall remain in effect it being the legislative intent that this stand notwithstanding the invalidity of any part notwithstanding anything in this the city and its officers shall act in accordance with the
